definition: to concentrate on
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
variant of 專|专[zhuan1]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: He followed the speaker's words with the greatest attention.
sentences.chinese: 他专心一意地倾听演讲者的话。

sentences.english: Only to concentrate more on things to do now is more perfect.
sentences.chinese: 只有更专注专心一意把现在的事情做到更完美。

sentences.english: Let us be single-minded in our devotion to Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 让我们专心一意奉献给主。

sentences.english: None of them faced the audience while standing at attention.
sentences.chinese: 他们没一个人面向观众，但却又专心一意地站着。

definition: deliberately/on purpose
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
one cannot concentrate on two things at the same time
in two minds about sth (idiom)/half-hearted/shilly-shallying
to concentrate entirely on sth/fully engaged/with full force
heart and soul/wholeheartedly
wholeheartedly/(to devote oneself) heart and soul
to concentrate one's attention/to be fully focused
to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
single-minded/concentrated
to be inattentive/to be distracted by sth
with heart and soul
see 誠心誠意|诚心诚意[cheng2 xin1 cheng2 yi4]
with all of one's heart
to worry about
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
